questions.question: What does the proverb "If a child washes his hands, he could eat with kings" mean?

choices.answer: Cleanliness is a virtue that's next to godliness.
It is essential to wash your hands before eating.
Children are dirty creatures.
If you wash away the soil, you can be king.

questions.question: What does the following proverb mean?                 "When the moon is shining, the cripple becomes hungry for a walk."

choices.answer: Moonlight can heal ailments- such as being crippled.
Adaptation is the key to survival.
Some opportunities are just too good to resist.
Hunger strikes at midnight.

questions.question: "Since mean have learned to shoot without missing, (the bird) has learned to fly without perching" means:

choices.answer: Birds make good target practice.
Men are like birds who long to fly away.
Some opportunities are just too good to ignore.
Adaptation is the key to survival.

questions.question: What does "The clan was like a lizard, if it lost it's tail it soon grew another" mean?

choices.answer: If a role within the community becomes vacant, someone will soon fill it.
Adaptability is key for survival.
Self renewal is a part of life.
When one dies, one will be reborn to live again.

questions.question: "I cannot live on the bank of a river and wash my hands with spittle." What does this proverb mean?

choices.answer: Cleanliness is next to godliness.
Why should I settle for less, when I could have better?
In a pinch, spit can work as well as water for washing hands.
One understands much when at the river.

questions.question: "A man who pays respect to the great paves the way for his one greatness." This means:

choices.answer: If you kiss up to those with power, you may become powerful as well.
Some opportunities are just too hard to resist.
One is more likely to receive respect when one shows respect to others.
If one is born great, nothing can stop him from achieving greatness.

questions.question: The proverb "Proverbs are the palm oil with which words are eaten" means

choices.answer: Food should always be cooked with palm oil.
If you show disrespect, you will eat your words.
Words are the sustenance of life.
Proverbs are used to make a thought easily grasped.

questions.question: What is meant by "If one finger brought oil, it soiled the others"?

choices.answer: If one tribesman brings trouble into the tribe, it will spread to others.
If you cook with oil, your fingers will become soiled.
One is more likely to receive respect when one shows respect to others.
Why should I settle for less, when I could have better?
